text: I use these constantly they're still supported. Do you have a page with a form you can link here?

The postMessage API emits messages that can only be intercepted on the `window` object.

You're using `document.addEventListener` try `window.addEventListener`
Also, you need to make sure that the event listener is defined before the form is loaded into the page otherwise the message will be posted and the listener won't be ready to intercept it

so I have this issue with my slider (tiny slider, the plain javascript carousel i use) and HubSpot forms..

In my header of the page i have this slider, that is specified by 3 slides with an image, some text etc. but also a form.
Now, not too crazy right? but when i want to use an infinite loop, what usually happens is that the slider makes clones of these slides and appends these to the DOM. Here is where it gets tricky, because the form is loaded through the DOM, the cloned slides do not possess the created form, while it was not there on the initialisation of the form.

Long story, i know, but is there any way to have my forms in the cloned slides?

1. Don’t use sliders
2. If you must use sliders, in this case you’ll need to use a custom form that uses the forms api to post to a HubSpot form
3. use <https://flickity.metafizzy.co/#wraparound|flickity> or another slider package that doesn’t clone/duplicate your slides
